CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The 'nodeName' variable is constructed by concatenating user-controlled input ('currNodeData.name') and then it is used as 'text' in 'FileListDialog.openWindow' function. If the user-controlled data is not properly sanitized, it could lead to XSS attacks where an attacker can inject malicious scripts.
